Recent scholarly work within science and technology studies STS has sought to develop a series of analytical tools for recognizing how such reconfigurations are taking place and understanding their implications for current understandings of life     et alBio objects and the Bio objectification processGoverning the researchcare divide in clinical biobanking : Dutch perspectives

In medical sociology and STS the relationships between research and care have been explored in a number of ways particularly through addressing the ways in which medical uncertainties are dealt with by practitioners and researchers Fox Timmermans and Angell Alderson   the consequences of intertwining research and care at the level of clinical practice Lwy Timmermans Wadmann and Hoeyer   the role of clinical trials as a constitutive component of clinical cancer care   Keating and Cambrosio   as well as the ways in which changing practices and processes of research and drug development affect the organization and practice of clinical care and public health Fisher    When experiments travel clinical trials and the global search for human subjectsGoverning the researchcare divide in clinical biobanking : Dutch perspectives

PSI is a large initiative aimed at providing a model for collaborative clinical biobanking across clinical disciplines and medical institutions in which University Medical Centres UMCs coordinate and account for the lions share of relatively highimpact biomedical research     et alPSI the Dutch academic infrastructure for shared biobanks for translational researchGoverning the researchcare divide in clinical biobanking : Dutch perspectives

We can sometimes guess at a candidate gene within the locus   Jostins et al   sometimes implicate a gene by virtue of an abundance of rare variants among affected individuals   Jostins et al   in rare circumstances use therapeutic modulation of a pathway to pinpoint the gene   Moon et al   and sometimes identify one by painstaking experimental dissection     et al   but generally identification of the underlying gene has not become easierFrom noncoding variant to phenotype via SORT at the p cholesterol locusDistilling Pathophysiology from Complex Disease Genetics

When known such as the effect of dietary cholesterol visa   vis genes involved in cholesterol metabolism in atherosclerosis such environmental exposures to genedeficient mouse models have provided a tight circle of proof     et al Severe hypercholesterolemia and atherosclerosis in apolipoprotein E deficient mice created by homologous recombination in ES cellsDistilling Pathophysiology from Complex Disease Genetics

Although the genome is linear its expression and biology are highly nonlinear and hierarchical being sequestered in specific cells and organelles    et al Cellular resolution models for even skipped regulation in the entire Drosophila embryoDistilling Pathophysiology from Complex Disease Genetics

In fact more than   confirmed loci each containing multiple genes affecting susceptibility to more than   medically relevant traits eg blood pressure and disease eg hypertension are now known     et al Potential etiologic and functional implications of genome wide association loci for human diseases and traitsDistilling Pathophysiology from Complex Disease Genetics

A recent example of gestational hypoxia modulating the effect of Notch signaling and leading to scoliosis in mice and in human families shows how environmental factors beyond diet can be examined even for congenital disorders    et al A mechanism for gene environment interaction in the etiology of congenital scoliosisDistilling Pathophysiology from Complex Disease Genetics

Eventually even computational models of tissue physiology such as for the cardiac system     et al   might be helpfulCirculation overall regulationDistilling Pathophysiology from Complex Disease Genetics

This approach has been highly profitable in Crohns diseasea common inflammatory disorder whose root causes remained cryptic until genomewide association studies identified a large number of loci with fundamental defects in mucosal immunity   Graham and Xavier but not in type   diabetes where the pathophysiology awaits clarification     and Pociot Genetics of diabetes Are we missing the genes or the disease Distilling Pathophysiology from Complex Disease Genetics

However imperfect animal models are progress in the direction of understanding causality has been very beneficial when gene disruptions alone perhaps at more than one gene have taught us fundamental lessons in pathophysiology    et al SnapShot Lung cancer modelsDistilling Pathophysiology from Complex Disease Genetics

So what might be rigorous proof of an attractive candidate ? In microbiology Robert Koch set out three postulates that had to be satisfied to connect a specific bacterium among the multitudes encountered not unlike current genome analysis to a disease : the agent had to be isolated from an affected subject the agent had to produce disease when transmitted to an animal and the agent had to be recoverable from an animals lesion    Molecular Koch s postulates applied to microbial pathogenicityDistilling Pathophysiology from Complex Disease Genetics

Any component locus for a complex disease has no such restriction as the causal variants are neither necessary nor sufficient nor coding in fact they are frequently noncoding and regulatory nor rare     et al Jostins et al Differential contributions of rare and common coding and noncoding Ret mutations to multifactorial Hirschsprung disease liabilityDistilling Pathophysiology from Complex Disease Genetics

There is indeed evidence for scenarios in which variation in complex traits including risk of complex disease is mediated by a myriad of variants of minute effect spread evenly across the genome    et al Genome partitioning of genetic variation for complex traits using common SNPsDistilling Pathophysiology from Complex Disease Genetics

Understanding this hierarchy the province of systems biology is critical to the solution of the complex inheritance problem     et al Dynamic regulatory network controlling TH cell differentiationDistilling Pathophysiology from Complex Disease Genetics

In the late   th century when bacteria were first shown to cause human disease they were indiscriminately implicated in all manner of disease with little proof    and Goldstein Koch s postulates for cholesterolDistilling Pathophysiology from Complex Disease Genetics

As the case for Marfan syndrome demonstrates the identification of fibrillin   mutations was insufficient to identify therapies without the concomitant understanding of the pathophysiology     et al Angiotensin II blockade and aortic root dilation in Marfan s syndromeDistilling Pathophysiology from Complex Disease Genetics

The crisis was understood to have spread geographically from the US economy to Europe and the worldwide although some financial markets were less affected such as those in Asia    Geographies of the financial crisisReconceptualising the space of markets the case of the   global financial crisis

The goal is to supplement a further distinctly geographical cut at existing socioeconomic conceptions of markets that can also permit engagement with wider debates in economic geography that would benefit with a more developed heterodox conceptualisation of markets for example the growing body of work on financialization French et al     amp Leyshon Editorial Financialization Space and PlaceReconceptualising the space of markets the case of the   global financial crisis

The financial crisis that gripped the global financial system in the latter half of   has prompted had significant and farreaching reevaluation of orthodox market theories and their associated neoliberal policy prescriptions    Kay Norfield   and this has persisted if not deepened with the sovereign debt crisis in the EU since   Lane Mody amp Sandri The Origins of the Financial Crisis central banks credit bubbles and the efficient market fallacyReconceptualising the space of markets the case of the   global financial crisis

In an earlier period economic geographers sought to spatialise analysis of markets around orthodox neoclassical conceptions and of course this branch of the subdiscipline has continued to develop within economics as the new economic geography Krugman    et al    amp Thisse New Economic Geography an appraisal on the occasion of Paul Krugman s   Nobel Prize in EconomicsReconceptualising the space of markets the case of the   global financial crisis

To date economic geographical thinking about markets in the heterodox tradition has either framed analysis of markets through the lens of political economic understanding neoliberal capitalism Peck   or tended to focus on specific aspects of market spatiality : the geographies of production Bathelt   circulation Berndt amp Broeckler   knowledge exchange and market creation    Bathelt amp Gluckler What counts Exploring the production of quantitative financial narratives inReconceptualising the space of markets the case of the   global financial crisis

Such a contention echoes   s   argument that there is a need for the sociotechnical literature on markets to not only address the question of spatiality but produce nuanced answersThe material production of virtuality innovation cultural geography and facticity in derivatives marketsReconceptualising the space of markets the case of the   global financial crisis

Markets as spatialised networks Economic geographical thinking about markets utilises the concept of the network in a number between actors who are conceived as nodes in the network    Spatial relationships Towards a reconceptualisation of embeddednessReconceptualising the space of markets the case of the   global financial crisis

However social scientists also now see the fate of national economic space as bound to the development of global marketplaces for goods and services    Bhagwati Friedman The Trifurcating Miracle Corporations Workers Bureaucrats and the Erosion of Japan s National EconomyReconceptualising the space of markets the case of the   global financial crisis

that reconfigures the concept of a network to a multiplex heterogenous and robust web of relations and it is a primary influence in the development of the concept of the network used by actornetwork theorists    Hassard Latour Actor Network Theory and AfterReconceptualising the space of markets the case of the   global financial crisis
